III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member has been buying youth items even though staff is
not supposed to buy things for the youth from their own money.
Staff member took youth for an x-ray and took her to a clothing
store after and encouraged her to hide the items under her shirt
when returning to the facility. Staff member confides information
about other staff with this youth. On 7/23/24, youth was assaulted
by 4 other youth and sent to the hospital. Staff member was upset
with another staff because they wanted to be with the youth at the
hospital. There are concerns that the staff member's substance
abuse impacts their ability to work.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was called on August 13, 2024, August 20, 2024,
and August 21, 2024. The Complainant was left detailed
messages on each date and never responded to the messages,
therefore was not interviewed.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 29,
2024. Youth A said none of the staff show favoritism towards any
youth. Youth A said if staff bring something in it is always for all the
youth and never just one. Youth A said no staff have ever bought
her anything out of their personal money. Youth A said she got into
a physical altercation with two other youth however does not
remember much of what happened, stating she “blacked out”.
Youth A said after the incident she went to the hospital for an
evaluation.
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 29,
2024. Youth B said she has been placed at New Hope Youth
Center for one week. Youth B said she has never seen any staff
show favoritism towards any youth. Youth B said she has never
seen staff buy items for any of the youth at New Hope Youth
Center. Youth B said she was present when Youth A and Youth D
got into a verbal and then physical altercation due to a
disagreement over a television show. Youth B said there were four
staff working and they stopped the altercation between the youth.
Youth B did not have any concerns about the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 29,
2024. Youth C said, “a lot of staff have favorite youth and show it
in front of everyone”. Youth C said Medical Technician will allow
Youth A on the computer for “long periods of time” and will not do
the same for other youth. Youth C said she has seen “multiple
staff” give “jewelry” to youth however was not able to provide any
specific staff, youth, or times when this occurred. Youth C said she
has told Director that staff “play favorites” and nothing is done
about it. Youth C said she was present when Youth A began to
“talk about other girl’s families” and “owning” New Hope Youth
Center. Youth C said that make her upset and so she started to
beat Youth A up along with Youth D. Youth C said three staff were
present and broke it up and called the police. Youth C said she
went to the hospital along with two other youth for a psychological
evaluation.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 29,
2024. Youth D said she received “lashes” for her birthday from
Staff 1, noting all the youth get something for their birthday from
staff. Youth D said other youth receive gifts from staff but was not
able to remember any specifics about which youth or which staff.
Youth D said, “the other day” she got into a verbal and physical
altercation with Youth A. Youth D said Youth A was “talking stuff”
and she was “sick of it”. Youth D said staff intervened right away
and “broke it up”. Youth D said she does not have any concerns
and feels safe at New Hope Youth Center.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
29, 2024. Supervisor said she works first shift and works with
Medical Technician “often”. Supervisor said she has never seen
Medical Technician buy Youth A anything out of her personal
money. Supervisor said Medical Technician was previously the
program director and was in charge of buying things for the youth
and the house so would come into work with purchases.
Supervisor said Medical Technician is nice to all the youth and
3

does not see her showing any special attention to Youth A.
Supervisor said Youth A does seek attention from staff more than
other youth and has been at the facility for longer than most and
so has created relationships with most of the staff. Supervisor said
recently Youth A has decided to try cheerleading at school and
Medical Technician used to be a cheerleader so they have talked
about that often. Medical Technician has been heard giving Youth
A advice and information about cheering. Supervisor said she has
never had any concerns about Medical Technician being under the
influence of anything while at work, noting she is always
professional and willing to help.
Medical Technician was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on July 29, 2024. Medical Technician said she previously was the
program director however recently transitioned back to medical
technician. Medical Technician said as program director she was
responsible for “needs requests” which is a process at the facility
where the youth will write down requests for certain things and
hand them to an administrator who then will decide if it is
approved and if so, she would purchase the item for the youth with
facility money. Medical Technician said youth would put in
requests for all sorts of items including clothing, special hygiene
products, or personal items. Medical Technician said normally she
will bring youth in groups to medical or dental visits however
recently she brought Youth A to a doctor’s appointment alone.
Medical Technician said while they were in the community she
brought Youth A to TJ Maxx to purchase a fanny pack. Medical
Technician said it had previously been discussed that Youth A
would be given a fanny pack or small purse to bring her inhalers to
cheerleading practice and football games, so they were not just
loose for her to lose or someone else to have access to. Medical
Technician said she did not have the facility credit card with her at
the time so purchased them on her own card and handed in the
receipt for reimbursement. Medical Technician said she has not
purchased items for Youth A or any other youth out of her own
personal money. Medical Technician said she was on call the
evening Youth A and the other youth got into the altercation.
Medical Technician said Staff 2 called her from the hospital stating
the nurse would not allow her into Youth A’s room to check in on
her and sit with her. Medical Technician said she spoke to the
nurse in the emergency room and explained what New Hope
Youth Center was and that the staff needed to be allowed into all
of the youth’s rooms to check on them and provide supervision.
Medical Technician said the nurse then allowed Staff 2 into the
room and Staff 2 put her cell phone on speaker phone because
Youth A wanted to say hello to her. Medical Technician said she
4

does not show favoritism towards any youth and interacts with all
of them.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
29, 2024. Director said she has worked with Medical Technician
for “a long time” and has not had any concerns with her coming
into work intoxicated. Director said she has not seen or heard of
Medical Technician showing favoritism to Youth A or purchasing
her items with her personal money. Director confirmed there is a
process in place for staff to be reimbursed if they are ever in a
position to have to purchase something with personal money.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on August 13, 2024.
Staff 1 said she has been employed at New Hope Youth Center
since April 2024. Staff 1 said she was working with two other
“new” staff and one staff that was in training the night that Youth A,
Youth C, and Youth D were in the altercation. Staff 1 said all the
youth agreed on a movie to watch however then began to
disagree about it once staff started it. Staff 1 said Youth C began
to make “nasty statements” about Youth A’s hygiene. Staff 1 said
Youth A began to argue back with Youth C and all of a sudden
Youth D “charged” Youth A. Staff 1 said she and the other staff
positioned themselves between the youth and attempted to stop
Youth D from assaulting Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth D reached
around staff and ended up making contact with Youth A. Staff 1
said the police were contacted and came to assist and ended up
taking three youth to the hospital, two for a psychological
evaluation and Youth A for a medical evaluation since she was hit
in the head. Staff 1 said one of the new staff rode to the hospital
with Youth A however then Staff 2 met him and took over the
supervision at the hospital. Staff 1 said Medical Technician
purchased a dress, fanny pack, and “a lot of other items” for Youth
A out of her personal money. Staff 1 said the reason she believes
the dress was bought from Medical Technician’s money is
because Youth A was trying to hide it under her shift from Staff 3
when she returned to the house. Staff 1 then clarified that she was
not working that day and had only heard about the incident. Staff 1
then said she was present when Youth A returned from a medical
appointment with a new fanny pack. Staff 1 said she was told that
Youth A was bought the fanny pack to bring her inhaler back and
forth to cheerleading. Staff 1 said she was told by Director that
was not a purchase off the facility card and there was no receipt
handed in for it. Staff 1 said Youth A had been with Medical
Technician when the fanny pack was purchased and therefore it
had to have been bought with personal money. Staff 1 said when
she began working at New Hope Youth Center she was training to
5

be the medical technician however was not able to be trained
while on shift so would call Medical Technician in the evening for
training. Staff 1 said Medical Technician sounded intoxicated
during the phone calls and would be asked two questions and she
would ramble on for two hours and never answer the questions.
Staff 1 said after the training calls Medical Technician would say
things were never discussed during the calls that clearly had been
talked about. Staff 1 said she has never seen Medical Technician
intoxicated at work. Staff 1 said Medical Technician is the support
person for many youth that will call her at night, but she is not
aware of any times when Medical Technician would answer while
intoxicated.
Staff 2 was called on August 13, 2024, and August 20, 2024.
Staff 2 did not answer her phone or return the voicemails left for
her. Staff 2 is no longer employed at New Hope Youth Center,
therefore was not interviewed.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on August 21, 2024.
Staff 3 said she has no knowledge of Medical Technician buying
Youth A or any other youth clothing or any other items out of her
personal money. Staff 3 said Medical Technician was previously
the program director and, in that role, would handle the youths
“needs requests” where they will fill out a request asking for
anything they need or want and Medical Technician would
determine if it was approved and if so, would go to the store and
buy the item with the agency credit card. Staff 3 said Medical
Technician would frequently buy youth items and bring them back
to the agency for the youth. Staff 3 said there was a shift she was
running where Youth A had been having poor behaviors that day
and the days prior, destroying the house, not following the rules,
and being disrespectful towards staff, and began to demand to be
brought to Rue 21 for a new shirt. Staff 3 said she told all staff,
Medical Technician included, that Youth A was not allowed to go
shopping due to her behaviors. Staff 3 said Youth A went on a
transport with Medical Technician and when she came back, she
had on a dress Staff 3 had never seen. Staff 3 said she called the
Assistant Facility Administrator and asked her to watch camera to
see if Youth A had the dress with her when she left for the outing.
Staff 3 said it was unable to be determined if she had the dress,
but it appeared she did have something under her shirt when she
left for the outing. Staff 3 clarified the concern in that situation was
not that Medical Technician had bought her the dress out of her
money, it was if Youth A was indeed brought shopping after Staff 3
said she was not allowed to go. Staff 3 said she has worked many
shifts with Medical Technician and has never been concerned that
6

she was intoxicated. Staff 3 said she has had to call Medical
Technician after hours for different reasons, and she has never
believed Medical Technician was intoxicated during those calls.
Documents Reviewed:
• Medical Technician’s personnel file: There was no
disciplinary record and Medical Technician completed
training on Youth-Staff Boundary policy in June 2024.
• New Hope Youth Center’s Youth-Staff Boundary policy was
reviewed. The policy states “Under no circumstance is an
employee, regardless of position, to do any of the following:
Demonstrate or exhibit special treatment to youth or give
gifts to you as special consideration. The facility may issue
policies for gift giving that are consistent for all youth and
directly from the facility budget and not any single staff
person.”
• New Hope Youth Center’s Standards of Conduct policy was
reviewed. The policy states “While not intended to list all
the forms of behavior that are considered unacceptable in
the workplace, the following are examples of rule
infractions or misconduct that may result in disciplinary
action, including termination of employment. Working under
the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there is no evidence to believe Medical Technician is
buying Youth A items out of her personal money, or that Medical
Technician has been intoxicated while working.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
